comment_text:
```suggestion
    line: export PATH="/usr/local/cuda/bin:$PATH"
```

We can keep them same since the path points to the latest cuda installation by default.

For example on my machine:
```console
$ readlink -f /usr/local/cuda
/usr/local/cuda-12.3
```

```suggestion
    line: export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/local/cuda/lib64:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH"
```
Same as https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/pull/3956/files#r1380347105 above.

```suggestion
echo 'export PATH=/usr/local/cuda/bin${PATH:+:${PATH}}' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}}' >> ~/.bashrc
```

Same as https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/pull/3956/files#r1380347105

pull_request_title: fix(docker):  avoid empty string in bake's arguments when `targets` not specified
comment_text:
It's from https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/pull/3253.
I'm sorry for my insufficient review in the PR.

However, the changes by this PR look a little redundant.
Is it impossible to write as follows instead?

```
targets="devel,prebuilt"
targets="*"
```

pull_request_title: fix(docker):  avoid empty string in bake's arguments when `targets` not specified
comment_text:
I got it. I'll revert it.
But unfortunately, I think your solution might not work.
If the targets are passed chained like `devel target`, them the `bake` will process the line as-is and the command will fail finally.
According to https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/buildx_bake/#file , when passing multiple targets to the `bake`, we have to specify the name(s) with space-separated manner... In scripting mode, targets should not be a single string but array-like.

@caiyuexiang Why do you want to split this option out of this if-statement?
I'm asking this because we need to keep the decision logs for future reviews.

Hi, @kenji-miyake , split this option just to maintain a uniform style of context, each option controls one args. And those two parameters under --runtime are added aims to minimize the options for exposed interface.

@caiyuexiang Thank you, but I'm sorry, I don't understand well. :cry: 
The if-statement was split, but both options are set simultaneously when `--runtime` is given.
So I don't understand the reason for splitting the if-statement.
Could you elaborate on this a bit more?
Hi, @kenji-miyake Since it's easy to cause confusion here, maybe I should keep the original if-statement and just replace the  --no-dev option with --runtime. What do you think?
It sounds clear and good to me!
If you want to change something, it's of course okay, but the reason should always be stated and reviewed.

Don't to need some TODO comment here?
For example, `TODO(TIER IV): Remove after apt released.`

```suggestion
  universe/external/cuda-api-wrappers: # TODO(TIER IV): Remove after apt released.
```

I'm not sure whether we should add TEIR IV's simulator-specific messages here.
I'd like to get reviews from @xmfcx @mitsudome-r @yukkysaito.

Why not adding the messages to https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware_msgs (Autoware's official messages) or https://github.com/tier4/tier4_autoware_msgs (TIER IV's proposal messages)?

Also, have you considered releasing the messages to the ROS buildfarm? Please share the discussion results.
In the cases of `autoware_msgs` and `tier4_autoware_msgs`, since they are still under construction, we're not planning to release them yet.

@kenji-miyake @yukkysaito cc: @yamacir-kit  
Thank you for the comments.
Let me confirm whether [scenarios_simulator_v2](https://github.com/tier4/scenario_simulator_v2) is being used as AWF's evaluator for the evaluation.
If scenario_simulator_v2 is tier4's specific repository, I think `scenario_simulator_v2_msgs` should be in https://github.com/tier4/tier4_autoware_msgs.

@mitsudome-r 
Do you know whether scenario_simulator_v2's position is AWF evaluator or tier4's evaluator?
(I heard scenario_simulator_v2 is being used by AWF's project but not sure if it's used as AWF's evaluator)

We are using TIER IV's evaluator in AWF as well.

However, that does not mean it has to go into autoware_msgs. If you want to make this a core interface between Autoware Foundation and simulator in general, it should go into autoware_msgs.(i.e., if you want to add this to AD API or component interface)

If this topic is only meant to be used by TIER IV, then it should be merged into tier4_autoware_msgs.

In either case, I would like to see more description on what/how this message is used for. You wrote that this message is needed to merge this [pr](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/pull/2514), but description in the PR doesn't explain what you want to solve. There is no design discussion shared with us to decide why we should add this message to Autoware.

@mitsudome-r 
I described how the msg is used for in this [pr](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/pull/2514). Could you check the description?
@kyoichi-sugahara What's your concern? I think it looks good. And it would be good if TIER IV could propose the message definitions to the AWF with more concrete use cases.

@kenji-miyake  cc: @yamacir-kit 
I was not sure where we should place the proposal msg and that is kind of my concern. So we will put the msg in `tier4_simulation_msgs` for now. And we will organize the what/why/how the msg is used so that AWF members can make decision where the msg should be placed. If it's ok I will close this pr.

Is it better to add .git?
```suggestion
    url: https://github.com/MapIV/eagleye.git
```

I see some packages([gnss_poser](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/tree/main/sensing/gnss_poser) and [geo_pos_conv](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/tree/main/sensing/geo_pos_conv)) that seem to do a similar thing with this repository.

Have you ever considered creating PRs to these packages rather than adding new repository?

@mitsudome-r 
The eagleye is not only used for autoware, but the packages you suggested are in autoware.universe or use their own messages, and they ware hard to incorporate them into ealgeye, so I did not modify or work on them this time.
Is it possible, for example, to manage those packages in autoware.universe and a separate repository?

Or maybe we could try to use [llh_converter](https://github.com/MapIV/llh_converter/tree/main) on the autoware side.

If we cannot use the node directly, I would at least would like to see some discussion between Map IV and TIER IV localization team about extraction of library to convert between lat/lon <-> x,y,z coordinates.
At least I see significant overlap in:
* https://github.com/MapIV/llh_converter/blob/main/include/llh_converter/llh_converter.hpp
* https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/blob/main/sensing/gnss_poser/include/gnss_poser/convert.hpp
so that we are using same projection between different nodes.
OK, I would like to discuss it once on the MAP IV side and then bring the discussion to TIER IV localization team.

I have discussed with @rsasaki0109 and @YamatoAndo on this.
In conclusion, we can merge this PR as a separate package for now to avoid unnecessary dependency between Autoware and Eagleye. However, as a long term, we would like to extract it as a common library once code is more stable.
https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/issues/2915
